Automation quickstart/amazon-sign-in.title: Selenium Amazon Sign-in Automation script
Automation quickstart/amazon-sign-in.description: This Python script uses the Selenium package to automate the Amazon sign-in process. The script launches a Chrome browser and navigates to the Amazon sign-in page, enters the email address and password, selects the remember me checkbox, and clicks the sign-in button. The script is designed to run on BrowserStack, a cloud-based testing platform.

Automation quickstart/GitHub-Actions.title: GitHub Actions
Automation quickstart/GitHub-Actions.description: GitHub Actions is a CI (Continuous Integration) and CD (Continuous Delivery) platform to automate build, test, and deployment pipelines. Create workflows to build and test every pull request to the repository or deploy merged pull requests to production.

Automation quickstart/Integrate-with-Bro.title: Integrate script with BrowserStack
Automation quickstart/Integrate-with-Bro.description: The BROWSERSTACK_URL constant is set to the URL of BrowserStack hub with the access credentials included to access the remote Chrome browser instance.

intro.title: Automation quickstart
intro.description: This document will guide you through the process of automating the Amazon sign-in page using selenium and integrating it with BrowserStack for continuous testing in your CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions.
